name: dep-tree
description: Tool for visualizing dependencies between files and enforcing dependency rules

repo.name: dep-tree
repo.description: Tool for helping developers keep their code bases clean and decoupled. It allows visualising a code base complexity using a 3d force-directed graph of files and the dependencies between them.

readme.summary: Excellent visual presentation and clarity on what the tool does, with strong installation options and compelling examples, but lacks basic usage instructions, configuration documentation, and troubleshooting guidance.
readme.top_issue: No quick start guide showing basic command-line usage after installation - the README cuts off mid-sentence in 'About Dep Tree' section and never shows how to actually run the tool

injection_risks.description: No injection risks found, but the use of generics could potentially lead to issues if not properly validated.
The 'helpScreen' function uses 'screen.SetContent' which could potentially be used for injection attacks if user input is not properly sanitized.

critical_findings: No critical findings were discovered, but it is recommended to add more input validation and error handling to improve the security of the application.
security.summary: The code has some potential security issues, including lack of input validation and potential injection risks, but overall it appears to be well-structured and secure.

common_complaints: Non-deterministic behavior in dependency violation reporting
Language/framework coverage gaps (Clojure, dynamic imports in JS/TS)
praise_themes: Tool concept and core functionality highly valued
Active feature requests indicating engaged users
sentiment.summary: dep-tree shows strong community health with engaged users making constructive feature requests, recent issue activity, and closed issues indicating active maintenance, though some technical debt around non-deterministic behavior and format flexibility remains.

communication.summary: The maintainer's responses are generally clear and helpful, showing patience with detailed questions and encouraging contributions.

concerns: No commits in past 6 months despite last commit being March 2025
No closed issues in past 6 months
No merged PRs in past 6 months
Zero active contributors in past 6 months
Unknown last release date suggests no recent release activity
maintenance.summary: dep-tree appears to be abandoned with no maintenance activity for at least 9+ months and unresolved open issues accumulating.

project_metrics.description: Tool for helping developers keep their code bases clean and decoupled. It allows visualising a code base complexity using a 3d force-directed graph of files and the dependencies between them.

analysis_summary.doc_summary: The documentation is visually appealing and provides a good overview of the package's functionality, but lacks clear instructions for getting started and troubleshooting.
concerns: No commits in the past six months, indicating a lack of active development.
Only one merged PR in the past six months.
Docs: Lack of quick start guide or basic usage example
Security: No critical findings were discovered, but it is recommended to add more input validation and error handling to improve the security of the application.
High bus factor risk (99% from top contributor)
highlights: Four contributors have been active in the past six months.
Recent activity with an open release and some open issues/PRs.
